SEARCH

Package org.fluentjdbc

package org.fluentjdbc
Fluent JDBC is a micro ORM - a library to help you generate and execute SQL statements with JDBC. There are two main ways to use the library: DbContext provides a way to bind a connection to the current thread and execute operations against DbContextTable objects created from the DbContext. Alternatively, you can create DatabaseTable instances and execute updates by providing your own Connection object.
  • Related Packages

    DatabaseBulkInsertBuilder<T>
    Fluently generate a INSERT ... statement for a list of objects.
    DatabaseBulkInsertBuilderWithPk<T>
    Variation of DatabaseBulkInsertBuilder which executes the statement with a request to return generated primary keys from the database and calls the registered update function for each object in the batch with the corresponding generated primary key
    DatabaseBulkQueryable<ENTITY,SELF extends DatabaseBulkQueryable<ENTITY,SELF>>
    Fluently create a statement for a list of objects with a WHERE ... clause, such as UPDATE or DELETE
    DatabaseBulkUpdatable<ENTITY,SELF extends DatabaseBulkUpdatable<ENTITY,SELF>>
    Fluently create a statement for a list of objects which updates values, ie INSERT or UPDATE
    DatabaseBulkUpdateBuilder<T>
    Fluently generate a UPDATE ... statement for a list of objects.
    DatabaseColumnReference
    Describes a database column alias for a SELECT * FROM table a JOIN table b ON a.column = b.column expression.
    DatabaseDeleteBuilder
    Generate DELETE statements by collecting field names and parameters.
    DatabaseInsertBuilder
    Generate INSERT statements by collecting field names and parameters.
    DatabaseInsertOrUpdateBuilder
    Generate a statement that will result in either an UPDATE ... or INSERT ... depending on whether the row exists already by collecting field names and parameters.
    DatabaseInsertWithPkBuilder<T>
    Generate INSERT statements with automatic primary key generation by collecting field names and parameters.
    DatabaseJoinedQueryBuilder
    DatabaseQueryBuilder used to generate joined queries using SQL-92 standard SELECT * FROM table1 a JOIN table2 b ON a.column = b.column.
    DatabaseListableQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseListableQueryBuilder<T>>
    Interface to execute terminal operations for SELECT-statements.
    DatabaseQueryable<T extends DatabaseQueryable<T>>
    Interface to build WHERE-expressions for SELECT-statements.
    DatabaseQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseQueryBuilder<T>>
    Interface for consistent query operations in a fluent way
    DatabaseQueryParameter
    Collects parameters for insert statements, update statements and where expressions
    DatabaseReporter
    An observer used to monitor the timing of queries.
    DatabaseResult
    Collects together a PreparedStatement and the resulting ResultSet, as well as metaData to map column names to collect indexes from ResultSetMetaData.
    DatabaseResult.DatabaseResultMapper<T>
    Used to execute statements on the whole DatabaseResult.
    DatabaseResult.RowConsumer
    Functional interface for DatabaseResult.forEach(org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseResult.RowConsumer).
    DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T>
    Functional interface for DatabaseResult.single(RowMapper, Supplier, Supplier) and DatabaseResult.list(RowMapper).
    DatabaseRow
    Retrieves column values for a single row returned by a query, if necessary, calculating the column position and doing necessary conversion.
    DatabaseSaveBuilder<T>
    Generate INSERT or UPDATE statements on a DatabaseTable by collecting field names and parameters.
    DatabaseSaveBuilderWithLong
    Subclass of DatabaseSaveBuilder which uses DatabaseInsertBuilder.setPrimaryKey(String, Object) in order to autogenerate primary key field
    DatabaseSaveBuilderWithoutGeneratedKeys<T>
    Subclass of DatabaseSaveBuilder which assumes the client code always specifies primary key field
    DatabaseSaveBuilderWithUUID
    Subclass of DatabaseSaveBuilder which uses UUID.randomUUID() to generate primary key values
    DatabaseSaveResult<T>
    Encapsulates what operation was executed when data was saved to the database.
    DatabaseSaveResult.SaveStatus
    The type of operation that was executed
    DatabaseSimpleQueryBuilder<T extends DatabaseSimpleQueryBuilder<T>>
    Interface for consistent UPDATE and DELETE operations in a fluent way
    DatabaseSqlBuilder
    Used to construct SQL SELECT statements in a flexible way with DatabaseQueryable.where(String, Object) clauses, DatabaseSqlBuilder.select(String...) column names, DatabaseSqlBuilder.from(String) table statement, DatabaseSqlBuilder.groupBy(String...), DatabaseSqlBuilder.orderBy(String) and DatabaseSqlBuilder.skipAndLimit(int, int).
    DatabaseStatement
    Allows the execution of arbitrary SQL statements with parameters and returns the ResultSet.
    DatabaseStatement.PreparedStatementFunction<T>
     
    DatabaseStatementFactory
    Controls the creation of DatabaseStatement objects, which allows for fine custom interception that affects all database operations.

    DbContextSqlBuilder

    DbContextUpdateBuilder
    Generate UPDATE insert statements by collecting field names and parameters.
    DbTransaction
    Controls whether the current thread will commit or rollback operations to database.
    MultipleRowsReturnedException
     
    NoRowsReturnedException
    Thrown on DatabaseStatement.singleObject(java.sql.Connection, org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T>) when no rows were returned
    SingleRow<TYPE>
    An internal alternative to Optional, but when you try to access a SingleRow.Absent single row (equivalent of Optional.empty(), an exception specified at creation time is thrown.
